content: Is this something in core that basically shouldn't be used? I noticed there's no rbmap.erase which would be very handy.
If it shouldn't be used, what's the best thing to use instead?
I started working on ordmap for this reason
do you need proofs? If no, you can use native.rb_map
If yes, you might find it easiest to work with alist
I'm currently working on updating the ordmap branch, which was left unmerged 2 years ago and so needs a bit of bitrot treatment
the proofs are not complete but the data structure itself works fine
I don't need proofs, I'll use native.rbmap thanks
It's a bit annoying that rb_map.min only returns data and not a key. Is this standard?
I'm afraid that native.rb_map is kind of take it or leave it, unless you want to add more ops in the C++
